title: Calories in a Biscuit
meta_description: Discover calories in biscuit, including full nutrition breakdown per serving, macros, and easy tweaks for variations like buttered or whole wheat.
assumptions: Standard American buttermilk biscuit, baked, plain (no fillings), ~57 g each, made with flour, butter, milk, baking powder.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, size, and preparation method (e.g., homemade vs. store-bought). Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One standard biscuit contains about 212 kcal and 4 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one biscuit?
faqs.a: Approximately 212 kcal for a standard 57 g buttermilk biscuit.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a biscuit?
faqs.a: About 26 g carbs, including 1 g fiber and 2 g sugars per biscuit.
Yes, around 10 g total fat per biscuit, with 3 g saturated.
Similar; a plain scone is ~200-250 kcal, but varies by recipe.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in biscuit?
faqs.a: Use low-fat milk, less butter, or opt for whole grain flour to cut ~15-30 kcal.
